Package org.dataconservancy.cos.rdf.annotations

Provides annotations used to map Java classes and members to OWL individuals and properties.

See: Description

  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    AnonIndividual
    Annotates a field which will be mapped to an anonymous OWL individual.
    IndividualUri
    Annotates a field to be used as a resource identifier for an OWL individual.
    OwlIndividual
    Annotates a class which will be mapped to an OWL individual.
    OwlProperty
    Annotates a field which will be mapped to an OWL property.

Package org.dataconservancy.cos.rdf.annotations Description

Provides annotations used to map Java classes and members to OWL individuals and properties.

Java classes annotated with @OwlIndividual will have instances of those classes represented in RDF as an OWL individual. Each class possessing the @OwlIndividual annotation should have exactly one field annotated @IndividualUri, to be used as the resource identifier of the @OwlIndividual.

Class members annotated with @OwlProperties will be represented in RDF as an OWL Datatype property or Object property, depending on the value of the annotation. The subject of the property will be the @OwlIndividual, and the object of the property will be the value of the annotated field.

The values of class members may be transformed prior to being represented in RDF. The @IndividualUri and @OwlProperties annotation possess a transform attribute, which specifies a Class<Function<Object,String>> to be applied to the field value prior to being serialized as RDF.
